00017 package WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedClosureClass;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedClosureClass - Protect instance data and only allow
00022 calling of specified methods.
00023 
00024 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00025 
00026  package MyScaryClass;
00027  
00028  sub new { return bless { @_[1..$#_] }, ref $_[0] || $_[0] }
00029  sub get_secret { return $_[0]->{secret_data} }
00030  sub set_secret { $_[0]->{secret_data} = $_[1] }
00031  sub use_secret { print "Secret length is ".length($_[0]->get_secret) }
00032  sub call_for_help { print "HELP!!" }
00033  
00034  package main;
00035  use WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedClosureClass;
00036  
00037  my $unlocked = new MyScaryClass(secret_data => "pErL iS gReAt");
00038  my $locked = new WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedClosureClass($obj, qw/use_secret call_for_help/);
00039  
00040  $unlocked->get_secret;                # OK
00041  $unlocked->set_secret("fOoBaR");      # OK
00042  $unlocked->use_secret;                # OK
00043  $unlocked->call_for_help;             # OK
00044  print $unlocked->{secret_data};       # OK
00045  $unlocked->{secret_data} = "WySiWyG"; # OK
00046  
00047  $locked->get_secret;                  # NG (not in method list)
00048  $locked->set_secret("fOoBaR");        # NG (not in method list)
00049  $locked->use_secret;                  # OK
00050  $locked->call_for_help;               # OK
00051  print $locked->{secret_data};         # NG (not a hash reference)
00052  $locked->{secret_data} = "WySiWyG";   # NG (not a hash reference)
00053 
00054 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00055 
00056 RestrictedClosureClass generates a wrapper object for a given object that
00057 prevents access to the objects instance data and only allows specified method
00058 calls. The wrapper object is a closure that calls methods of the underlying
00059 object, if permitted.
00060 
00061 This is great for exposing a limited API to an untrusted environment, i.e. the
00062 PG Safe compartment.
00063 
00064 =head1 CONSTRUCTOR
00065 
00066 =over
00067 
00068 =item $wrapper_object = CLASS->new($object, @methods)
00069 
00070 Generate a wrapper object for the given $object. Only calls to the methods
00071 listed in @methods will be permitted.
00072 
00073 =back
00074 
00075 =head1 LIMITATIONS
00076 
00077 You can't call SUPER methods, or methods with an explicit class given:
00078 
00079  $locked->SUPER::call_for_help         # NG, would be superclass of RestrictedClosureClass
00080 
00081 =head1 SEE ALSO
00082 
00083 L<perltoot/Closures-as-Objects>
00084 
00085 =cut
00086 
00087 use strict;
00088 use warnings;
00089 use Carp;
00090 use Scalar::Util qw/blessed/;
00091 
00092 sub new {
00093     my ($invocant, $object, @methods) = @_;
00094     croak "wrapper class with no methods is dumb" unless @methods;
00095     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00096     croak "object is not a blessed reference" unless blessed $object;
00097     my %methods; @methods{@methods} = ();
00098     my $self = sub { # CLOSURE over $object, %methods;
00099         my $method = shift;
00100         if (not exists $methods{$method}) {
00101             croak "Can't locate object method \"$method\" via package \"".ref($object)."\" fnord";
00102         }
00103         return $object->$method(@_);
00104     };
00105     return bless $self, $class;
00106 }
00107 
00108 sub AUTOLOAD {
00109     my $self = shift;
00110     my $name = our $AUTOLOAD;
00111     $name =~ s/.*:://;
00112     return if $name eq "DESTROY"; # real obj's DESTROY method called when closure goes out of scope
00113     return $self->($name, @_);
00114 }
00115 
00116 1;
